newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan July export orders up 1.75 percent yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan July export orders up 1.75 percent yr/yr.

text.p: Foreign orders for Taiwan goods rose 1.75 percent in July from a year earlier to US$9.77 billion, the economics ministry said on Wednesday.
The following is a table of export data in millions of U.S. dollars.
Orders from the United States rose 13 percent to $3.08 billion. The main increase was due to orders of information and telecommunication products.

Orders from Hong Kong decreased 7.04 percent to $1.69 billion. The ministry attibuted the decline to decreasing raw material demand from China, whose imports of Taiwan goods are routed through Hong Kong. It noted that China's own exports have slowed.
Orders from Japan fell 6.54 percent to $1.27 billion due mainly to an increase in Japanese tariffs on imports of pork.
European orders grew 8.75 percent to $1.47 billion on strong demand for information and telecommunication products.
Orders in Taiwan's key information and telecommunications sector grew 15.14 percent to $1.43 billion and electronic product orders grew just 0.75 4.11 percent to $1.35 billion.
Textile orders fell 11.18 percent to $1.19 billion and base metal products orders decreased 6.6 percent to $790 million.
Plastic and rubber products orders were down 1.96 percent to $650 million.
Orders for machinery fell 4.11 percent to $580 million.
